trans-unit.source: Connect to an Azure SQL Database with Excel
trans-unit.target: Connect to an Azure SQL Database with Excel

trans-unit.source: Excel spreadsheet to Azure SQL Database for reporting and data exploration.
trans-unit.target: Excel spreadsheet to Azure SQL Database for reporting and data exploration.

trans-unit.source: Connect to an Azure SQL Database with Excel
trans-unit.target: Connect to an Azure SQL Database with Excel

trans-unit.source: Connect Excel to an Azure SQL Database and create a report over the data in the database.
trans-unit.target: Connect Excel to an Azure SQL Database and create a report over the data in the database.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: An Azure SQL Database provisioned and running.
trans-unit.target: An Azure SQL Database provisioned and running.

trans-unit.source: To create a new SQL Database, see [Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: To create a new SQL Database, see [Getting Started with Microsoft Azure SQL Database](sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Excel 2013](https://products.office.com/en-US/) (or Microsoft Excel 2010)
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Excel 2013](https://products.office.com/en-US/) (or Microsoft Excel 2010)

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database and Create Report
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database and Create Report

trans-unit.source: Open Excel.
trans-unit.target: Open Excel.

trans-unit.source: In the menu bar at the top of the page click **Data**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu bar at the top of the page click **Data**.

trans-unit.source: Click **From Other Sources**, then **From SQL Server**.
trans-unit.target: Click **From Other Sources**, then **From SQL Server**.

trans-unit.source: The **Data Connection Wizard** opens.
trans-unit.target: The **Data Connection Wizard** opens.

trans-unit.source: ![Data connection wizard][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Data connection wizard][1]

trans-unit.source: In the **Server name** box, type the Azure SQL Database server name.
trans-unit.target: In the **Server name** box, type the Azure SQL Database server name.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: In the **Log on Credentials** section, select **Use the following User Name and Password** and then type in appropriate credentials for the SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: In the **Log on Credentials** section, select **Use the following User Name and Password** and then type in appropriate credentials for the SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Note: Both [PowerPivot](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=102) and [Power Query](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39379) add-ins for Excel have very similar experiences.
trans-unit.target: Note: Both [PowerPivot](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=102) and [Power Query](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39379) add-ins for Excel have very similar experiences.

trans-unit.source: In the **Select Database and Table** dialog, select the **AdventureWorks** database from the pull-down menu and select **vGetAllCategories** from the list of tables and views, then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Select Database and Table** dialog, select the **AdventureWorks** database from the pull-down menu and select **vGetAllCategories** from the list of tables and views, then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: ![Select a database and table][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Select a database and table][5]

trans-unit.source: In the **Save Data Connection File and Finish** dialog, click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Save Data Connection File and Finish** dialog, click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Import Data** dialog, select **PivotChart** and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Import Data** dialog, select **PivotChart** and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: ![Select Import Data][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Select Import Data][2]

trans-unit.source: In the **PivotChart Fields** dialog, select the following configuration to create a report for the count of products per category.
trans-unit.target: In the **PivotChart Fields** dialog, select the following configuration to create a report for the count of products per category.

trans-unit.source: ![Configuration][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Configuration][3]

trans-unit.source: Success looks like this:
trans-unit.target: Success looks like this:

trans-unit.source: ![success][4]
trans-unit.target: ![success][4]

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: If you are a Software as a Service (SaaS) developer, learn about [Elastic Database pools](sql-database-elastic-pool.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are a Software as a Service (SaaS) developer, learn about [Elastic Database pools](sql-database-elastic-pool.md).

trans-unit.source: You can easily manage large collections of databases using [Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: You can easily manage large collections of databases using [Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-overview.md).
